title: Regulations, 1964 to 2018 and these Regulations may be cited together as the
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Superannuation (Designation
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Superannuation (Designation 

of Approved Organisations) Regulations, 2020. 

(2) The Superannuation (Designation of Approved Organisations) 
Regulations, 1964 to 2018 and these Regulations may be cited together as the 
Superannuation (Designation of Approved Organisations) Regulations, 1964 to
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited superannuation (designation approved organisations) regulation 2020 (2) superannuation (designation approved organisations) regulation 1964 2018 regulation may cited together superannuation (designation approved organisations) regulation 1964

title: Regulations, 1964 to 2018 and these Regulations may be cited together as the
Regulations, 1964 to 2018 and these Regulations may be cited together as the
heading: 2. The organisations specified in the Schedule to these Regulations are
text_raw:
2. The organisations specified in the Schedule to these Regulations are 
hereby designated as approved organisations for the purposes of Section 4 of 
the Superannuation and Pensions Act, 1963 (No. 24 of 1963). 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 1st May, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [150] 3

heading: Industrial Development Agency (Ireland)
text_raw:
SCHEDULE 

Industrial Development Agency (Ireland) 

The Irish Museum of Modern Art 

Residential Institutions Statutory Fund Board 

Legal Services Regulatory Authority 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

23 April, 2020. 

PASCHAL DONOHOE, 

Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform.

title: Regulations, 1964 to 2018 and these Regulations may be cited together as the
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation) 

Section 4 of the Superannuation and Pensions Act, 1963 provides for the 
transfer of pensionable service in the case of staff transfers between the Civil 
Service and “approved organisations”, and between one “approved 
organisation” and another. These regulations designate the organisations set out 
in the schedule as “approved organisations”.
